segments.text: I watch the water cascading over the edge of the sink, a small but growing disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kitchen, which should feel safe, now has an undercurrent of danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think about how the woman is so lost in her task that she can’t see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are so caught up in their little heist; it’s innocent and mischievous at the same time.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a surge of irritation for the boy; he has to know that stool isn’t stable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's outstretched hand could either mean victory or disaster, depending on how this plays out.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone realizes the precariousness of this scene before it ends in a fall.
segments.speaker: PAR
